Bamsoet Maju Caketum, Timses Airlangga Bicara Laknat Allah
04 Nov 2019, 04:30 by Budiarti Utami Putri, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian DPP Partai Golkar Azis Syamsudin enggan berkomentar banyak ihwal niat Bambang Soesatyo alias Bamsoet maju sebagai calon ketua umum Golkar di musyawarah nasional Desember mendatang. Azis juga enggan mengomentari kesepakatan antara Bambang dan Airlangga Hartarto soal pencalonan itu.
Sebelumnya, sejumlah politikus di kubu Airlangga mengklaim Bamsoet tak akan maju lantaran sudah menjadi ketua Majelis Permusyawaratan Rakyat. Saat santer kembali isu Bamsoet akan maju, kubu Airlangga sontak menyindir ihwal kesepakatan itu.
"Kalau melanggar komitmen kan biar masyarakat yang menilai, biar Allah yang melaknat, kan gitu," kata Azis yang juga tim sukses Airlangga ini di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan, Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Kubu Airlangga merujuk pada pernyataan Bamsoet beberapa waktu lalu. Kala itu, kedua politikus beringin itu menyatakan sepakat menurunkan tensi demi menghindari perpecahan di internal partai.
Seusai sebuah pertemuan yang digelar di rumah Ketua Umum Nasdem Surya Paloh, Bamsoet menyatakan mendukung Airlangga sebagai ketua umum Golkar di munas mendatang. Pernyataan itu terekam dalam tayangan sebuah stasiun televisi dan dokumentasi Partai Golkar.
Tak lama berselang Bamsoet pun menjadi ketua MPR yang dicalonkan Golkar. Kursi ketua MPR ini pun dianggap sebagai deal politik agar dia tak maju sebagai calon ketua umum.
Namun, dalam sejumlah kesempatan lain, Bamsoet tak pernah secara tegas menyatakan urung maju sebagai calon ketua umum. "Biarlah ini jadi rahasia antara saya, Pak Airlangga, dan Tuhan yang tahu," ujar Bamsoet di sejumlah kesempatan berbeda.
Ditanya soal komitmen ini, Azis pun mengaku tak tahu. "Nah itu, yang tahu antara Pak Airlangga, Pak Bamsoet sama Allah yang tahu. Biar yang mengingkari, biar Allah yang melaknatnya," ujar Azis.
text:
Bamsoet Forward Caketum, Airlangga Timses Talking the Word of God
Nov 04 2019, 04:30 by Budiarti Utami Putri, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Golkar Party DPP Coordinating Chairperson Azis Syamsudin was reluctant to comment much about Bambang Soesatyo's alias Bamsoet's intention to step forward as Golkar's general chairperson in the national assembly next December. Azis was also reluctant to comment on the agreement between Bambang and Airlangga Hartarto about the nomination.
Previously, a number of politicians in the Airlangga camp claimed that Bamsoet would not advance because he had become the chair of the People's Consultative Assembly. When the issue of Bamsoet was widely resumed, the Airlangga faction suddenly quipped about the agreement.
"If it violates the commitment, let the people judge, let God curse, right?" Said Azis, who is also the Airlangga success team at the Parliament Complex, Senayan, Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Airlangga faction refers to the statement of Bamsoet some time ago. At that time, the two banyan politicians said they agreed to reduce the tension in order to avoid divisions within the party.
After a meeting held at the house of Nasdem Chairperson Surya Paloh, Bamsoet expressed his support for Airlangga as Golkar's general chair in the coming general assembly. The statement was recorded in the broadcast of a television station and Golkar Party documentation.
It was not long before Bamsoet became the chair of the MPR nominated by Golkar. The chair of the People's Consultative Assembly was considered a political deal so that he would not advance as a candidate for the general chair.
However, on a number of other occasions, Bamsoet never explicitly stated failing to advance as a candidate for chairman. "Let this be a secret between me, Pak Airlangga and God who knows," Bamsoet said on a number of different occasions.
Asked about this commitment, Azis also claimed not to know. "Now, those who know between Pak Airlangga, Pak Bamsoet and Allah who knows. Let those who deny, let God curse them," Azis said.
